title: Replace wheel navigation with a simple, accessible reel bottom navigation

requirements.summary: Remove wheel navigation UI, hook usage, and wheel-specific styling so nothing wheel-related renders or intercepts scrolling in the reel experience.
acceptanceCriteria: WheelNavScroller is no longer imported or rendered (including on the ReelHome page and empty-feed state).
The wheel-scroller hook is no longer used anywhere in the app.
Wheel-specific CSS utilities/classes are removed or no longer referenced so they do not affect layout/behavior.
The reel feed scroll behavior is not blocked by any remaining wheel event listeners.

file_operations.description: Remove the WheelNavScroller component implementation so it can no longer be imported or rendered anywhere.
Remove the wheel-scroller hook to eliminate wheel event listeners and selection logic tied to the wheel navigation mechanic.
Remove WheelNavScroller import and usages in both the empty-feed state and the main reel feed, ensuring no wheel navigation is rendered or referenced.
Remove wheel navigation utility/classes (e.g., wheel-nav-container, wheel-nav-item, wheel-nav-item-selected) so wheel styling no longer affects layout/behavior.

requirements.summary: Add a simple, popular-feeling bottom tab navigation on the reel route with accessible controls and Create Post integration.
acceptanceCriteria: A replacement navigation UI is available on the main reel route ('/'), providing one-tap access to core sections (Home/Reel, Discover, Create Post, Messages, Profile, Hub).
Navigation supports mouse/touch and keyboard accessibility (tab focus + Enter/Space activation) with clear English labels/aria-labels.
Create Post opens the existing create-post flow/modal (no broken navigation or dead buttons).
The new navigation does not interfere with vertical scroll-snap usage on the reel feed.

file_operations.description: Create a new simple bottom tab navigation component for the reel-first experience (not a wheel). Use existing shadcn/ui components by composing (e.g., Button, dialog/modal triggers) and lucide icons; include clear English labels and aria-labels, keyboard activation (Enter/Space), and a Create Post trigger that opens the existing CreatePostModal. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire the new ReelBottomTabNav into the reel route so it is consistently available on '/'. Ensure it is positioned in a fixed, non-scroll-blocking way that does not interfere with the reel vertical scroll-snap.

requirements.summary: Update the reel page layout to use only the new navigation component (no wheel/duplicate patterns) and ensure all targets route correctly.
acceptanceCriteria: ReelHome uses the new navigation component instead of WheelNavScroller (including the empty-feed state).
The navigation appears in a single, consistent place on the reel route (no duplicated wheel + bottom nav combinations).
All navigation targets route correctly using the existing router paths ('/', '/discover', '/messages', '/profile', '/hub').

file_operations.description: Ensure ReelHome renders exactly one navigation pattern on the reel route by using the new ReelBottomTabNav in both loaded and empty states, and removing any remaining wheel/bottom-nav duplication.

Implement navigation actions using the existing TanStack Router paths ('/', '/discover', '/messages', '/profile', '/hub') and keep Create Post opening the existing CreatePostModal. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Apply a coherent modern theme to the new navigation and reel experience with clear active states and English UI text (avoid blue/purple as primary identity).
acceptanceCriteria: The navigation component has a consistent visual style (colors, typography, spacing, states) that matches the rest of the app.
Active/selected state is clearly visible and accessible (sufficient contrast, not color-only).
User-facing text in the new UI is in English.

file_operations.description: Add/adjust lightweight utility classes for the new bottom navigation (container background, blur, borders, safe-area padding, focus-visible ring, and an active state that is not color-only, e.g., shape/underline). Ensure the style aligns with the existing red-forward primary tokens and avoids blue/purple as the primary identity.

Apply the updated theme styling classes and ensure active state is both visually distinct and accessible (contrast + non-color cue), while keeping all user-facing labels in English. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
